story.title: Beneath Your Mask - Episode 10
story.storyDescription: An anonymous admirer is texting Heather at a costume party‚Ä¶

story.prePaywallNotification: Aww‚Ä¶Connor is being so sweet and patient with Heather! üíó Will she put down her shields for him? Tap back into Hooked to find out.
story.postPaywallNotification: WHAT? Why does the fireman know Heather‚Äôs name?? Tap back into Hooked to find out.

messages.text: The next morning, Heather sits on the floor, facing the superhero dolls lined up on her couch.
They‚Äôve been like an advice panel after a restless night of no sleep.
And now it‚Äôs finally time to text Jenna‚Ä¶
I‚Äôve made up my mind, for better or worse.
And?
And‚Ä¶God, Jen. I‚Äôve never put myself out there like this before.
Eeek! Go Heather!!!
Just remember that Connor has put himself out there for YOU over and over again.
He isn‚Äôt a fluke. He‚Äôs SO into you.
Just wish me strength, okay?
ü§ó ‚ù§Ô∏è üí™
Not long afterward, Heather is standing in front of Connor‚Äôs fire station.
Her shields are all the way down.
With her hands trembling, she takes a deep breath, then texts him.
Help. I think I‚Äôm in need of a rescue, and Nightwing isn‚Äôt the guy for this job.
There‚Äôs no immediate answer.
Losing courage by the moment, Heather‚Äôs shields start to creep up again‚Ä¶
Then an older fireman wanders out. He spots her and tips up his baseball cap.
Let me guess. You‚Äôre here just to say hi to Connor?
Oh.
You say that like it‚Äôs a regular occurrence or something.
What can I tell you? The guy‚Äôs a charmer.
He just walked down to the market. He should be back in a few.
A charmer. How stupid was she for falling into his trap and thinking this was a good idea?
It gets even worse as the fireman looks her over.
It‚Äôs clear he doesn‚Äôt think she‚Äôs as busty or pretty as Connor‚Äôs usual type.
But by the time he gets to her face, he‚Äôs smiling, almost as if he‚Äôs glad she‚Äôs here‚Ä¶
Are you, by any chance, Heather?
Just as confusion swamps her, she hears a deep voice behind her.
Yeah, Jerry, this is Heather.
With a gasp, she turns around, finding Connor dressed in his fireman tee and trousers.
He puts down his shopping bag, gazing at her intently.
It‚Äôs as if he‚Äôs seeing her bare, without anything to cover her own exposed emotions.
Her first instinct is to run, but then he moves closer to her.
Everyone here knows your name. I can‚Äôt stop telling them about this woman I met.
The plain, mouthy one named Heather?
No. The one who‚Äôs got me so upside down that I can barely function.
They‚Äôve been dying to meet Heather because they don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs real.
See, Jerry ‚Äî she‚Äôs real!
Heather glances over at the smiling fireman to discover a few more guys have wandered out.
She turns back to Connor to find that he‚Äôs still watching her with hunger‚Ä¶
And adoration.
This is crazy.
What is?
I already told you that you‚Äôve caught me.
I‚Ä¶
Stop running, Heather.
It‚Äôs just that‚Ä¶
She blows out a breath, knowing she‚Äôs losing‚Ä¶
Or maybe this is what winning feels like‚Ä¶
You‚Äôve got one more chance to get out of this before I fall.
He moves even closer.
Why would I take a chance like that?
Because I don‚Äôt come as advertised.
I‚Äôm not a Captain-ette America or Poison Ivy. I‚Äôm a super mess.
Bullshit.
I see the secret identity you‚Äôve been hiding, and I already adore it.
True, you were hot and amazing in your costumes, but goddamn‚Ä¶
You‚Äôre everything I want in a woman.
But‚Äî
Heather, when lightning strikes like it did with us, everything changes.
I know that underneath it all, you‚Äôre so smart and caring.
Better than anyone I‚Äôve ever met‚Ä¶
And I want to find out what else you‚Äôve been keeping undercover.
Heather holds her breath, thinking that she‚Äôs going to wake up any moment from a dream.
But all she can do is whisper.
No one has ever said anything like this to me.
I‚Äôll keep saying it until you believe it.
He reaches his hand out to her with a hopeful smile.
Her heart kicks as she feels herself losing her grip on her security blankets‚Ä¶
Then in a burst of emotion, she rushes to him.
When he sweeps her into a head-spinning, world-altering kiss, cheers break out.
She and Connor ignore them, finally coming up for air, looking deep into each other‚Äôs eyes‚Ä¶
I believe you, Connor.
It took someone like you to show me what I‚Äôm made of.
You did that for me too.
God, Heather‚Ä¶
Once again, he kisses her to breathless, giddy heights as hot blood surges through her body‚Ä¶
Then, totally high on her hero, she whispers in his ear.
Even though our identities have been exposed, tell me‚Ä¶
Could you still get that mask for us?
Connor‚Äôs sexy Nightwing smile is all the answer she needs.
